intro: Casearia arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfak casearia, is a shrub native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, berry-like fruits. The botanical features of Casearia arfakensis make it an important species in the ecological studies of the region.
